meanings.definition: The universe seen as a well-ordered whole.
meanings.sent1: Looking up at the stars, I felt like I was a tiny part of the cosmoses.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the cosmoses to understand the vastness of space.
meanings.sent3: The aliens marveled at our little planet in the cosmoses, thinking it was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cosmoses of thoughts, each one shining brightly in its own orbit.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the cosmoses at night left me in awe of the universe's grandeur.

meanings.sent1: The garden was a cosmoses of blooming flowers, each one complementing the other.
meanings.sent2: In the bustling city, there was a cosmoses of traffic lights guiding the flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The classroom ran like a well-oiled cosmoses, with students following the rules diligently.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was a cosmoses of color-coded blocks, ensuring she never missed an appointment.
meanings.sent5: The orchestra played in perfect cosmoses, each instrument blending harmoniously with the others.
